attributes.comment:
Families should be encouraged, not discouraged, to adopt. Increasing USCIS fees
not only discourages families from adopting, but also actively discriminates
against families of lower incomes. In addition, the current fee, high at it is, in no
way gurantees timely processing of paperwork. Paperwork that is "suppossed" to
take 8 weeks is routinely taking 7-8 months. Furthermore, the process is by no
means standard across processing centers or states. On one side of my state
you can get paperwork completed in DAYS, while at another office it took 8
months.

All children deserve a home, and we should make the process as efficient and
clear as possible.

Thanks

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
